greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows, T(n, k) = binomial(2*k, k)*binomial(n, k), 0<=k<=n.
comment: This sequence gives the coefficients of the Jensen polynomials (increasing powers of x) of degree n and shift 0 for the central binomial sequence A000984. For a definition of Jensen polynomials see a comment in A094436. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 25 2019
link: O. T. Dasbach, A natural series for the natural logarithm, Electronic Journal of Combinatorics, (15) 2008 #N5.
formula: Let R_n(x) denote the row generating polynomials of this triangle, which begin
[Dasbach] gives the following slowly converging series for the logarithm function:
The polynomials (1-x)^n*R_n(x/(1-x)) appear to be the row polynomials of A135091 (see also A117128). (End)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Sep 09 2004
